question: Which Indian-origin personality has been honoured with the highest civilian award "Order of Australia" in Australia for community work?
explanation: Guruswamy Jayraman, a 69-year-old Indian-origin Glenwood resident, has been honoured with the highest civilian award \"Order of Australia\" in Australia  for community work, the highest civilian award in Australia.  He works as a senior accountant with Woollahra Municipal Council for a living and has been devoting most of his spare time in community work for the last 25 years. He has represented various community organisations like Auburn Diversity Services, Hindu Council of Australia, Sri Om Adi Sakhi Ashram, Sewa International Australia, etc. Jayraman migrated from Delhi to Australia in 1991.
